instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
Hi,

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> logic board with no previous damage, When plug magsafe there is no green light, there is no voltage on any rails. DC board is ok because connected to other board it works. Already tried with few board.

Tried to measure 5 pins on dc board and all them are at 0. It's like something is blocking magsafe. 


Any suggestion?


Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
Leakage on input stage blocks the charger.
I bet you will get some voltages, maybe working board, using fake charger, or bench power supply.

Post exact value (onboard, ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86.
Usually bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>.

Also check for any short on the board.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR>/12 are both OK and no short at <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> 97.8 Kohms
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> 62 Kohms
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> 317 kOhms
<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> 416 kOhms. 


When i was checking i noticed that <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR>/95 were burn When removed both i got 16V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR>. 

<RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR>/12 both are ok 

Also changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and the result is the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> can get burnt because of C/<CHIP>U6990</CHIP>.
<RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR> never, as it has 1M; possibly corroded, yes.
Now <DIODE>D6995</DIODE> possibly burnt too.
Check/change all them and be sure no short at L6995.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
It was <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> shorted to ground. Thank you very much 2informaticos. 

Problem solved.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no rail. It is not dc board.
threads.message:
New issue detected. 

Macbook runs from power adapter and battery. If run from power adapter and disconnect it it shuts down. If run from battery and conect than disconet the battery it shuts down.
